description:
The _get_node() method in the Ironic virt driver has the following signature and docstring:

    def _get_node(self, node_uuid):
        """Get a node by its UUID."""

However, there are 4 places in the code where this method is called that passes the string for the nodename instead:

node_is_available()
_node_from_cache()
plug_vifs()
unplug_vifs()

I don't know how any of these are working, but I guess the periodic update that correctly calls _get_node() with a UUID keeps the node cache current.
title: Ironic driver calling _get_node() with nodename

comments.content:
I read around in the code a bit more on this and it appears to basically be a bad variable name: the nodename is node_uuid. See, for example: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py#L512-L516

the hackery seems to be on the resource tracker where hypervisor hostname is ironic node uuid?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cdent

comments.content:
To be clear, in ironic, the nodes all have unique UUIDs. They can also have optional unique names (string). The actual code/ironic call in in _get_node() mentioned by Ed above, will work for a node UUID or a node string.

However, with respect to the ironic driver code in nova, it *only* uses the ironic node UUID, not the ironic node name (since that may not exist for all ironic nodes). The confusion is in the use of 'nodename' vs 'node UUID' in the driver code :-(

I suppose we could change and/or add clarifying documentation where 'nodename' is used in that file.

    Original bug text:
    The _get_node() method in the Ironic virt driver has the following
    signature and docstring:
    
        def _get_node(self, node_uuid):
            """Get a node by its UUID."""
    
    However, there are 4 places in the code where this method is called
    that passes the string for the nodename instead:
    
    node_is_available()
    _node_from_cache()
    plug_vifs()
    unplug_vifs()
    
    I don't know how any of these are working, but I guess the periodic
    update that correctly calls _get_node() with a UUID keeps the node
    cache current.
    Original bug text END!
    
    This change addresses bug 1704231. In the Ironic driver nodename is
    often times used because the inherited class uses nodename for method
    parameters. However the ironic driver doesn't actually use the
    nodename but uses node_uuid. Driver.py is update by code in some
    places and documentation in others to try to make it more clear
    that node_uuid is being used without changing the signature of the
    methods that are inhereted.

    Closes-Bug: #1704231
